thread.title: No candidate found suitable for promotion as district judge in Rajasthan: Not an isolated instance - India Today
thread.title_full: No candidate found suitable for promotion as district judge in Rajasthan: Not an isolated instance - India Today

author: @indiatoday
title: No candidate found suitable for promotion as district judge in Rajasthan: Not an isolated instance - India Today
text:
None found suitable for promotion as district judge in Rajasthan: Not 1st instance
The Rajasthan High Court notified that the result of the written examination for promotion in the cadre of district judge by way of limited competitive examination, 2024, was declared as "none found suitable".
In Short
- Rajasthan High Court found no candidate eligible for district judge promotion
- Competitive exam for district judge post held on March 8 and 9
- Similar instances have occurred in Telangana, Gujarat, Odisha
The Rajasthan High Court has announced that none of the candidates who appeared for the limited competitive examination for promotion to the district judge cadre in 2024 have been found suitable. The written test was held on March 8 and 9.
The High Court on Tuesday notified that the result of the written examination for promotion in the cadre of district judge by way of limited competitive examination, 2024, was declared as "none found suitable".
This is, however, not the first such case. Instances like these underscore the rigorous standards and challenges associated with the appointment of judges.
In several states, the recruitment process for district judges faced challenges related to the suitability of candidates.
In February 2025, none of the 366 candidates in Odisha who appeared for the written examination for 45 district judge positions qualified for the interview round.
These candidates who took the test included advocates and judicial officers and none of the candidates who took the test qualified.
As per the registrar's notices, none qualified in the written examination for direct recruitment to the posts in the cadre of district judge from among the advocates and judicial officers.
In November 2024, the Telangana High Court declared that no candidates were selected for the district judge (entry level) positions in the Telangana State Judicial Service.
In a notification issued by the registrar recruitment, it was stated that no candidate has been selected to the post of district judge (entry level) notified for 2024 in the Telangana State Judicial Service under direct recruitment and the vacancies notified will be carried forward to the next year.
The result was for the appointment to nine posts of district judge (entry level) by direct recruitment.
In 2019, the Madras High Court conducted the preliminary examination for direct recruitment of district judges in Tamil Nadu. However, out of over 3,500 applicants, no one had qualified.
This was after applications were called for from practicing advocates, assistant public prosecutors and so on.
In 2022, the Gujarat High Court declared the result of the recruitment process for district judges post as 'nil'. The process was conducted for the appointment of 34 posts of district judge.
None of the applicants, including lawyers and judicial officers, qualified for the post of district judges. This wasn't the first time. Even in 2019, none of the advocates who appeared could clear the recruitment process.
Even the Jammu and Kashmir Judicial Service has seen more than one such instance.
In 2022, over 200 candidates appeared for recruitment to the posts of district judges, but nobody qualified. The process was conducted for filling up seven posts of district judges, but none of the applicants qualified for the direct recruitment examination.
